ch.aplu.android

Class GGInputDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.GGInputDialog

  • public class GGInputDialog
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to show a modal dialog with an edit field and two buttons (Ok, Cancel). Because by Android system design modal dialogs are not supported, this workaround is only permitted when invoked by the main thread (in the main() method).

    When the dialog is shown, the current screen orientation is saved, but the device may be flipped to enter the text in the user preferred orientation. When Ok or Cancel is clicked, the saved screen orientation is restored and fixed in order to avoid the restart of the main thread.

      static java.lang.String show(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String init)

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public static java.lang.String show(android.app.Activity activity,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String prompt,
                    java.lang.String init)
        Same as show(String title, String prompt, String init) with given activity.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity where to show the dialog
        title - the title text of the dialog box
        prompt - the prompt text of the dialog box
        init - the text shown in the edit field when the box pops-up
        Returns:
        the trimmed text in the edit field; null if the Cancel button is pressed

      • show

        public static java.lang.String show(java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String prompt,
                    java.lang.String init)
        Halts the main thread and shows the modal dialog box and a Ok and Cancel button. When the Ok button is pressed, the current text in the edit field is returned (empty string, if the field is empty) and the main thread continues to run. The screen orientation is fixed to what is was before, even when the screen is rotated while the dialog is shown.
        Parameters:
        title - the title text of the dialog box
        prompt - the prompt text of the dialog box
        init - the text shown in the edit field when the box pops-up
        Returns:
        the text in the edit field; null if the Cancel button is pressed

      • show

        public static java.lang.String show(java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String prompt)
        Same as show(String title, String prompt, String init) with init = "".
